page.title: 09ALL SAINTS WINGERWORTH
page.content: The{Church of England} has All Saints Church in Wingerworth. It has a building of several distinct parts, still having some of the original Norman building, the 1783 mausolem and the 1963 extension. We talked to the rector, Reverend Millington. He works 10 hours a day and only has Saturday off, unless there is a wedding, but he still likes his job. He takes on average 4 services a week, usually 300 people attend on Sunday. His most important service is Holy Communion. There are a number of church groups which members of the community can join, ie.{Mothers Union, Sunday {School, Young Wives. }The {Scouts}and {Guides}are also linked to the church.
